Posts.Content: LeftyofAZ wrote: If you are currently undergoing Chemo or know of someone that is, please pass the word that there is a cleaning service that provides FREE housecleaning - 1 time per month for 4 months while the person is in treatment. All you have to do is sign up and have your doctor fax a note confirming the chemo treatment. Cleaning for a Reason will have a participating maid service in the zip code area of the patient arrange for the service  http://www.cleaningforareason.org I wanted to use this service while I was going through chemo but  was unable to do so due to I live in a rural area that didn't have participating service. This organization serves the entire US and currently has 547 partners to help clean. Be a blessing to someone and pass on this information. Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2009 02:16PM LeftyofAZ wrote: My general surgeon performed my lumpectomy under general anesthetic as outpatient surgery at the hospital.  Had numerous mammograms, and ultrasounds prior to the removal of the lump.. These diagnostic tools are used to laydown a roadmap as to what needs to be removed, exact location, size of the mass, etc, etc. Please get a second opinion! Wishing you well
